alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Butler; Lawrence (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 12:17AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following county, Columbiana. Portions of Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Beaver, Butler and Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1217 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cranberry, Butler, Beaver Falls, East Palestine, Ellwood City, Homeacre-Lyndora, New Brighton, Shanor-Northvue, Meridian, Zelienople, Rochester, Ohioville, Seven Fields, Meadowood, Oak Hills, Sarver, Evans City, Mars, Patterson Township and Big Beaver. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
